question: Where did a certain horse-dealer live?
answer1: in South of Scotland, near the Border, not very far from Longtown

question: Who was a certain horse-dealer?
answer1: Canonbie Dick

question: What did Canonbie Dick have behind him as he went up and down the country?
answer1: a long string of horses

question: Where was Canonbie Dick riding over?
answer1: Bowden Moor

question: Who were resting under the three high peaks, waiting for the mystic call that shall awake them?
answer1: King Arthur and his Knights

question: Who had white hair and an old-world dress and seemed almost to start out of the ground?
answer1: a venerable man

question: What did Canonbie Dick do while he was riding over Bowden Moor?
answer1: rode along at a snail's pace, thought over the bargains which he had made at the fair that day, and wondered when he was likely to dispose of his two remaining horses

question: How did Canonbie Dick feel when the stranger stopped to buy his horses?
answer1: surprised

question: What did the old man do when he could not bargain with the horse-dealer?
answer1: agreed to buy the animals, and, pulling a bag of gold from the pocket of his queerly cut breeches, he began to count out the price

question: How will Canonbie Dick feel when the stranger does not give him gold?
answer1: surprised

question: What did the stranger give to Canonbie Dick instead of gold?
answer1: Unicorns, and Bonnet-pieces, and other ancient coins

question: Why wouldn't the stranger's coins be of use to the horse-dealer in his everyday transactions?
answer1: The coins were not the gold that was used at the time.

question: Why did Canobie Dick took the stranger's coins?
answer1: It was good, pure gold.

question: What did the stranger do before the two parted?
answer1: commissioned Dick to get him other good horses at the same price

question: What was the stipulation that the stranger made?
answer1: the only stipulation he made being that Dick should always bring them to the same spot, after dark, and that he should always come alone.

question: What did the horse-dealer do whenever he came across a suitable horse?
answer1: lead it over Bowden Moor after dark, and he was sure to meet the mysterious, white-headed stranger

question: How was the stranger different from Canonbie Dick's ordinary customers?
answer1: The old man never provided him with something to drink.
answer2: The old man only paid and left with his horses.

question: Why did Canobie Dick want to go home with the stranger?
answer1: He wanted to have refreshments.

question: What did the stranger do when Canonbie Dick asked to go home with him and have a little refreshment?
answer1: The stranger gave him a warning.
answer2: The stranger told Canonbie Dick that he needed courage to follow him back home.

question: Why did Canobie Dick feel a bit startled when he saw the entrance to the cavern?
answer1: he never remembered having seen any opening in the hillside there before?

question: How did Canonbie Dick feel when he was wondering where he was being taken?
answer1: scared

question: Where did Canonbie Dick and the stranger find themselves after they were enveloped in thick darkness?
answer1: an enormous cavern lit by flaming torches

question: What will Canonbie Dick do after he sees the motionless horses, knights, and steeds?
answer1: follow the old man up the hall to the far end of it

question: Who was the stranger?
answer1: Thomas the Rhymer

question: Why did the stranger ask Canonbie Dick if he knew Thomas the Rhymer?
answer1: The stranger wanted to reveal his identity.
answer2: The stranger wanted to tell him who he was.

question: What will Canonbie Dick choose?
answer1: the Horn

question: How did Canonbie Dick feel when he was choosing between the Horn and the Sword?
answer1: nervous

question: Why didn't Canonbie Dick choose the Sword?
answer1: The spirits might believe he was a threat.
answer2: The spirits might band together against him.

question: What happened when Canonbie Dick choose the Horn?
answer1: Thunder rolled in crashing peals through the immense hall.
answer2: The charmed Knights and their horses woke in an instant from their enchanted sleep.

question: What did the Knights do when they woke up from their enchanted sleep?
answer1: sprang to their feet and seized their swords, brandishing them round their heads

question: What did the horses do when they woke up from their enchanted sleep?
answer1: stamped, and snorted, and ground their bits, as if eager to escape from their stalls

question: Why did Canonbie Dick lose his courage?
answer1: He was terrified at seeing so many threatening faces turned towards him.

question: What did Canonbie Dick try to do after he dropped the Horn?
answer1: made one weak, undecided effort to pick up the Sword

question: What happened after Canonbie Dick tried to pick up the Sword?
answer1: A perfect whirlwind of cold, raw air tore through the cavern, carrying the luckless horse-dealer along with it; and, hurrying him along the narrow passage through which he had entered, dashed him down outside on a bank of loose stones and shale.

question: What did Canonbie Dick do the next morning?
answer1: whispered the story of his weird and fearful adventure
